body:
Currently, when workflow received a signal, if there is not already a workflow task scheduled, temporal server will schedule a new workflow task immediately. 

There are cases where application want to hold on triggering new workflow task upon receiving signals. For example, application knows that a number of signals will come in certain time window, and the workflow requires all of them to be able to make next decision. In that case, trigger a new workflow task on each received signal is a significant waste of resource.

A naive approach would be adding an optional flag to signal request, that says SkipNewWorkflowTask.
title: Signal without immediately trigger a workflow task
